event: Here is the table of events and timestamps:
fetal heart rate 143 beats per minute
fetus situated longitudinally with cephalic presentation, back to the left
posterior body placenta maturation grade III
4 contractions every 10 minutes that lasted 40 to 45 seconds
fetus in left occiput anterior position
placenta came out with normal characteristics
bilateral ligation of the anterior trunk of the hypogastric artery
uterus regained tone in approximately 5 minutes
2 bags of packed red blood cells transfused
transferred to the medical intensive care unit
description of the technique of bilateral ligation of the hypogastric artery in its anterior trunk
initial anatomic reference from where the retroperitoneum is incised
bifurcation of the common iliac artery identified
correct identification of the decussation of the ureter above the artery
retroperitoneum dissected parallel to the entire course of the hypogastric artery
anterior trunk is carefully dissected until it is completely freed and ligated with absorbable catgut suture 1-0
ligation of the anterior trunk of the hypogastric artery bilaterally
effective, safe, and fertility-preserving surgical procedure
